text:
Just like <taskdef> is a top-level element, so should <typedef>.  This would
allow types to be created at a top level then simply referenced within tasks.

The effort should not be large, totally encapsulated within ProjectHelper.
Simply mimic the structure for handling a taskdef:  Add a check for "typedef" in
ProjectHandler.startElement(), a handleTypdef() method, and an associated
TypedefHandler inner class.
